_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility:  AGChoice Emporia

Location:  1779 Road G, Emporia, KS 

Contact:  Robert Bluma

Phone:  620-342-4775





1. The Facility Policy



MFA Enterprises and the employees of the AGChoice Ammonia Plant in Emporia are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Lyon County LEPC, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



The primary activity at the facility is the receiving, storage and distribution of anhydrous ammonia for direct application as a crop nutrient. The facility also handles and sells other crop input products.



3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program.



The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, 1999", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc. The facility also meets the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia", and the Kansas Fertilizer Law. Currently the facility is evaluating the requirements of CGA G-2.1-2014 and will make the required upgrades if needed.



4. The Five-year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program.



    The facility has;



    a. a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA

        Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



    b.  provided State and Local authorities with the emergency

        planning and community right-to-know information as

        requir

ed under SARA Title III (EPCRA);



        c. employees will not respond to any release other than to activate

           an emergency shut-off while evacuating the facility. Local

           emergency responders will be notified to control any release.



6. Planned changes to improve safety.



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. Currently the facility is evaluating the requirements of CGA G-2.1-2014 and will make the required upgrades if needed.



12/2/2019
